thread.title: Hockey history for sale: How to buy New York Rangers' Stanley Cup rink
thread.title_full: Hockey history for sale: How to buy New York Rangers' Stanley Cup rink

author: Lindsay Kramer | lkramer@syracuse.com
title: Hockey history for sale: How to buy New York Rangers' Stanley Cup rink
text:
Comments 
New York Rangers fans who want to hold on to history for as long as they can have a chance to do exactly that with the franchise's greatest moment. 
According to a story in The Hockey News, the rink on which the Rangers won the 1994 Stanley Cup is up for sale. 
Goldin Auctions is taking bids starting on Monday on the dasher boards, glass, replacement panels of glass, a complete set of steel ice dams, benches and nets. Mark Messier, Brian Leetch and Mike Richter are among the players who have signed some of the items 
The opening bid is a cool $50,000. 
Here's a thought: Crunch owner Howard Dolgon is a life-long Blueshirts fan. 
How about he coughs up the spare change for the rink, ship it up to Syracuse and set it up in the Oncenter parking lot as an interactive display for the AHL All-Star Classic this season? You could charge a couple bucks per person and let fans play street hockey in it. 
Pays for itself. 
It would be a perfect fit for a couple of reasons. The rink would be the jewel showcase of an event designed to pay tribute to both the AHL's 80th anniversary and hockey history in New York State. 
And the Rangers won that Cup the spring before the Crunch arrived in town for the 1994-95 season. In the finals New York beat Vancouver, which was Syracuse's first parent team.
